channel.title: IMP-Mouse
channel.description:
I am now able to send and filter events to rs2 applets loaded from rs2's homepage. I can currently [block, filter, create] Focus Events, Mouse Events, and Window Events.
ROAD MAP 2. srl interfaced with (IMP-Mouse) 2. taking bitmap screenshots of a applet without the applet being visable. (yes it is possbile) 3. r-bot simple scripting ide 4. r-bot beta for slave auth holders 5. r-bot (free) 6. r-bot dll plugin system for ultra fast bitmap functions(free) 7. r-bot safe script approval system (free) 7. r-bot scheduler (pro) 8. r-bot map-walker, based on color, user draws path on palette (pro)
track back http://www.impsoft.net/viewtopic.php?t=91

item.title: IMP-Mouse
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:12, topic:3537”][quote author=GenoDemoN link=topic=4242.msg42645#msg42645 date=1149259349]
yours will be alot slower ill tell you that now mopar.
[/quote]

entirely possible, but I can use SCAR on mine, you have to write your own engine entirely, have no script or scripter base, and sorry to say but I dont see how anything can be better than SCAR

but it would be a major accomplishment on your part, dont take what Im saying as “you suck, or bad job”, its great that your doing all that you are ;)[/quote]
mine works fine with scar…

Read full topic

item.description:

I am now able to send and filter events to rs2 applets loaded from rs2’s homepage. I can currently [block, filter, create] Focus Events, Mouse Events, and Window Events.

I am now able to send and filter events to rs2 applets loaded from rs2’s homepage. I can currently [block, filter, create] Focus Events, Mouse Events, and Window Events.

me too, yay but Im doing it in java, and you can use SCAR with it

I wonder who will finish first, probably you, because im busy as hell

me too, yay but Im doing it in java, and you can use SCAR with it

I wonder who will finish first, probably you, because im busy as hell
[/quote]
you better be using a ton of jni or package a extra cpu with the download.[/quote]

no jni, you can use it in linux or on a mac if you want (of course SCAR doesnt run on linux or mac, but you can still use my webclient on those os’s)
